Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.Group
          • Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GridListener<java.lang.Integer>, javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class Board
extends javafx.scene.Group
implements GridListener<java.lang.Integer>
    Deals with all the printing and assignment of random letters to the board that the user will see in order to play the game.
    Author:
    Bill Xiang

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(double letterSize)
        initializes tile size of each individual tile of the board.
        Parameters:
        letterSize - (size of letter)

    • Method Detail

      • setLetters

        public void setLetters(Letter[][] letters)
        Sets the letters to whatever cell in the board. Also sets the color of the cells. Allows for the mouse to control behavior of the letter in the board.
        Parameters:
        letters - 2-D array of letters.

      • resetCells

        public void resetCells()
        Resets the board to a new game, filled with new letters. Allows for mouse handling events and also sets the aesthetic and colors of each cell.

      • xPosForCol

        public double xPosForCol(int col)
        Returns the X position of the cell in that column
        Parameters:
        column - number
        Returns:
        X position given column number

      • yPosForRow

        public double yPosForRow(int row)
        Returns the Y position of the cell in that column
        Parameters:
        row - number
        Returns:
        Y position given column number

      • colForXPos

        public int colForXPos(double x)
        Returns the column number given an x-position
        Parameters:
        x - the x position
        Returns:
        the column given the x position

      • rowForYPos

        public int rowForYPos(double y)
        Returns the row number given a y-position
        Parameters:
        y -
        Returns:
        the row given the y position

      • cellChanged

        public void cellChanged(int row,
                        int col,
                        java.lang.Integer newVal)
        The method called when the cell changed responding to its drag gesture status, (if its been dragged on in the current gesture.) It sets the cell to the appropriate color
        Specified by:
        cellChanged in interface GridListener<java.lang.Integer>
        Parameters:
        row - the row number
        col - the column number
        newVal - the new value being changed to

      • gridReplaced

        public void gridReplaced()
        The method called in response to the ending of the drag gesture. Resets the color of each cell back to the default color.
        Specified by:
        gridReplaced in interface GridListener<java.lang.Integer>

      • setModel

        public void setModel(GridModel<java.lang.Integer> model)
        Sets grid mode of letters and resets the cells.
        Parameters:
        model - representing the order that cells have been dragged in a drag gesture

      • getLetters

        public Letter[][] getLetters()
        Returns the array of letters that is going to be used in the board.
        Returns:
        2-D array of letters.
